intro: Stewartia ovata f. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered stewartia, is a variant of the stewartia tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has broad, ovate leaves that are dark green and glossy on top, with a lighter underside. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained, acidic soils.
